arts.ttl: Serie A | Bologna 2-0 Como: Match Report
arts.sum: Bologna secured a crucial victory against 10-man Como, further solidifying their position in the race for a top-four finish in Serie A. The match, which ended 2-0 in favour of the Rossoblu, saw goals from Lorenzo De Silvestri and Giovanni Fabbian. The post Serie A | Bologna 2-0 Como: Match Report appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Bologna vs. Como: objectives to pursue
arts.sum: After the 2-2 draw in the reverse fixture last 14 September, Bologna and Como could draw both seasonal Serie A matches for only the second time after 1949-50 (two 2-2 draws in the first two ever meetings between the two teams in the competition). Among the teams faced at least 15 times in Serie A, Bologna are the one against which Como have the lowest percentage of defeats (26%); in fact Como remained unbeaten in 14 of their 19 matches against the Rossoblu in Serie A (W8 D6).

arts.ttl: Serie A | Bologna v Como: Match Preview
arts.sum: As the Serie A season enters a crucial phase, Bologna welcomes Como to Stadio Dall'Ara on Saturday evening in a match that could have significant implications for both teams' aspirations. The hosts, fresh from their Champions League campaign, are pushing for European qualification, while Como are fighting to secure their top-flight status. arts.sum: Bologna FC is actively exploring options to strengthen their defensive lineup, with AC Milan's right-back Davide Calabria emerging as a potential target. The Rossoblu have made initial inquiries about the Italian defender, signalling their interest in bolstering their squad.
